definition: paragon of virtue and learning/exemplary character
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
to serve as a model for others (idiom)/to be a worthy teacher
model teacher of every age (idiom)/eternal paragon/refers to Confucius (551-479 BC) 孔子[Kong3 zi3]

sentences.english: You know best "role models" of weight.
sentences.chinese: 你最清楚“爲人師表”的份量。

sentences.english: An instructor is a person of exemplary virtue, and a true example of his students.
sentences.chinese: 教師應該爲人師表，他是學生學習的真實榜樣。

sentences.english: The professor is. a paragon of virtue and learning.
sentences.chinese: 這位教授堪稱爲人師表。

sentences.english: They will abide by this code, be worthy of the name of teacher, and be modeled by their students.
sentences.chinese: 全校教師應遵守本守則，爲人師表，做學生的楷模。

definition: to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
model teacher of every age (idiom)/eternal paragon/refers to Confucius (551-479 BC) 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
